result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Court's response to request to have victim's father appear by phone at sentencing hearing:

"Request granted."  (dr)
Letter to Judge requesting phone appearance for victim's father.
Order for Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation Report
Defendant remanded until sentencing.

Defendant Evan M Thompson in court, in custody.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Evan M Thompson.  Attorney James T. Sempf in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:02 a.m. Matter was set for final pre-trial but matter has resolved. Record by Atty. Maynard as to limited agreement of the parties. Court goes over maximum penalties and deportation warnings. Defendant responds to Court's questions as to plea questionnaire. Atty. Response to Court's questions as to plea and stipulation to facts.
Defendant pleads GUILTY to Count #1.
Court finds plea to be knowing, voluntary, intelligent, and finds defendant guilty.
Victim's mother is in court but does not wish to make a statement.

Court will order PSI and goes off the record for scheduling.

Back on the record - State asks for remand. Response by Defense that Defendant remains on $20,000 cash bond with no way to post so they do not object. Court grants State's request. Bond revoked and defendant remanded until sentencing.
Email from Atty. Maynard regarding Motion as to Videotaped Statement of Child

Defendant Evan M Thompson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Evan M Thompson.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Andrew Herrmann. Defendant Evan M Thompson appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Evan M Thompson. Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Evan M Thompson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James T. Sempf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Evan M Thompson. Called @ 1:49 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on motion to modify bond as to both files - 22CF139 & 22GF221. Court addresses the state as to the bond motion. Record/argument by Atty. Sempf as to his objections, severity of the charges, and potential charges, and lack of change of any circumstances. Response/argument by Atty. Kim. Based upon the record, Court denies the motion to modify bond.
Atty. Sempf responds to Court's questions regarding GF file. Court will require complaint to be filed by the arraignment date for 22CF139 on April 20th. Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.

Based upon the record, Court denies the motion to modify bond.

Called 1:42 PM. Defendant Evan Michael Thompson appeared in court, in custody by video. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kim appears late. Court goes over charges. Minutes filed.

Called 1:42 PM. Defendant Evan Michael Thompson appeared in court, in custody by video. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kim appears late. Court goes over charges. Signed bond filed with the court.

PROHIBIT INTERNET USE OR ACCESS. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ANY MINORS. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
